IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR AUBURN UNIVERSITY INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR AUBURN UNIVERSITY INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS
IRS990.Desc: THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS EXTRACURRICULAR SPORTS PROGRAMS. IT RECEIVES AND ADMINISTERS FUNDS FOR SCIENTIFIC, EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES, FOR AND ON BEHALF OF AUBURN UNIVERSITY FOR THE AUBURN INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS. THIS INCLUDES, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS, ATHLETIC PROGRAM ENHANCEMENTS, ATHLETIC-RELATED EQUIPMENT PURCHASES AND CONSTRUCTION OF ATHLETIC FACILITIES.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: PROOF OF THE PUDDING BY MGR

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ESTABLISHED FOR PROGRAM SUPPORT AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE FOUNDATION FOLLOWS THE ACCOUNTING GUIDANCE FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. AS OF JUNE 30, 2022 AND 2021, THE FOUNDATION HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND NO INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAXES.
DIRECT EXPENSES FOR FUNDRAISING EVENTS SHOWN AS AN OFFSET TO INCOME PER TAX RETURN (SEE SCHEDULE O FOR EXPLANATION). 21,661,706.
DIRECT EXPENSES FOR FUNDRAISING EVENTS SHOWN AS AN OFFSET TO INCOME PER TAX RETURN (SEE SCHEDULE O FOR EXPLANATION). 21,661,706.

RecipientTable.NonCashAssistanceDesc: MOBILE BUILDING, GRAPHICS & SIGNAGE, COOKING & SERVING EQUIPMENT
RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: ATHLETIC PROGRAM SUPPORT AND STUDENT SCHOLARSHIP SUPPORT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GRANTEE, AUBURN UNIVERSITY, IS A SECTION 115 ENTITY. AS A LAND-GRANT INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION, ITS MAJOR SOURCE OF FUNDS IS STATE APPROPRIATIONS AND ITS DISBURSEMENTS ARE RESTRICTED OR GOVERNED BY STATE LAW. SINCE IT IS GOVERNED BY THE STATE OF ALABAMA, ITS TRANSACTIONS ARE SUBJECT TO PUBLIC DISCLOSURE AND THE FOUNDATION HAS ACCESS TO ITS FINANCIAL RECORDS. GRANTS DESIGNATED FOR A SPECIFIC PURPOSE ARE CREDITED TO A FUND ESTABLISHED SPECIFICALLY FOR THAT PURPOSE. THE AUBURN UNIVERSITY PAYMENT SERVICES DEPARTMENT ENSURES COMPLIANCE WITH THE FUND'S RESTRICTIONS.
THE AMOUNTS SHOWN IN PART 1, COLUMN B FOR "NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS" REPRESENTS THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS CONTRIBUTED AND NOT NECESSARILY THE TOTAL NUMBER OF ITEMS CONTRIBUTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DECISIONS OF GOVERNING BODY SUBJECT TO APPROVAL: THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY APPROVES EXPENDITURES MADE BY THE FOUNDATION WITHIN THE AUBURN ATHLETICS DEPARTMENT BUDGET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 REVIEW PROCESS: THE ASSISTANT TREASURER/DIRECTOR OF FINANCE REVIEWS THE FORM 990 WITH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE BEFORE THE FILING DUE DATE. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS DELIVERED TO THE FULL GOVERNING BODY PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY: ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, THE ASSISTANT TREASURER PROVIDES TO ALL DIRECTORS, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, MEMBERS OF SENIOR MANAGEMENT, AND AUBURN UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEES WITH PURCHASING AND/OR HIRING RESPONSIBILITIES OR AUTHORITY, A LIST OF ALL VENDORS WITH WHOM THE FOUNDATION HAS TRANSACTED BUSINESS AT ANY TIME DURING THE PRECEDING YEAR. ANY REPORTABLE CONFLICTS SHALL BE DISCLOSED IN WRITING TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEWS ALL WRITTEN DISCLOSURES SUBMITTED BY AUBURN UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEES, AND THE AUDIT COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW ALL WRITTEN DISCLOSURES SUBMITTED BY DIRECTORS AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, AND DETERMINE THE APPROPRIATE RESOLUTION. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING ALL DECISIONS CONCERNING RESOLUTIONS OF CONFLICTS INVOLVING DIRECTORS, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, AND OTHER MEMBERS OF SENIOR MANAGEMENT. SHOULD THE REPORTABLE CONFLICT INVOLVE A MEMBER OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OTHER THAN THE CHAIR OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, THE CHAIR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING ALL DECISIONS CONCERNING RESOLUTIONS OF CONFLICTS INVOLVING THE AUDIT COMMITTEE MEMBER. SHOULD THE CONFLICT INVOLVE THE CHAIR OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING ALL DECISIONS CONCERNING RESOLUTIONS OF THE CONFLICT. A DIRECTOR OR AUBURN UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEE MAY APPEAL A DETERMINATION THAT AN ACTUAL OR APPARENT CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS. THE APPEAL MUST BE DIRECTED TO THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD. APPEALS MUST BE MADE WITHIN 30 DAYS OF THE INITIAL DETERMINATION. RESOLUTION OF THE APPEAL SHALL BE MADE BY VOTE OF THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS. BOARD MEMBERS WHO ARE THE SUBJECT OF THE APPEAL, OR WHO HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTERESTS WITH RESPECT TO THE SUBJECT OF THE APPEAL, SHALL ABSTAIN FROM PARTICIPATING IN DISCUSSING OR VOTING ON THE RESOLUTION, UNLESS THEIR DISCUSSION IS REQUESTED BY THE REMAINING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION: THE FOUNDATION HAS NO EMPLOYEES. THIS QUESTION IS ANSWERED WITH RESPECT TO AUBURN UNIVERSITY (A RELATED ORGANIZATION). COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BASED ON MARKET SURVEYS DONE WITHIN AUBURN UNIVERSITY'S HUMAN RESOURCES. IF INFORMATION IS NOT AVAILABLE, INTERNAL EQUITY ISSUES DETERMINE SALARY GRADE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCESS OF MAKING FOUNDATION'S DOCUMENTS & STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FORM 990 ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THREE DIRECTORS AND THREE OFFICERS OF THE FOUNDATION ARE EMPLOYEES OF A RELATED ORGANIZATION, AUBURN UNIVERSITY, AND THEIR TOTAL SALARIES ARE PAID BY AUBURN UNIVERSITY, AND ARE THEREFORE LISTED AS 40 HOURS PER WEEK FOR THE RELATED ORGANIZATION. CHARLES T. JACKSON, SECRETARY, AND MARKA W. BLACKERBY, ASSISTANT TREASURER, WORK ALMOST ENTIRELY ON FOUNDATION RELATED MATTERS, AND ARE ALSO LISTED AT 40 HOURS PER WEEK FOR THE FOUNDATION. LORI T. ARTHURS IS THE CFO FOR THE AUBURN UNIVERSITY ATHLETICS DEPARTMENT AND DIVIDES HER TIME BETWEEN FOUNDATION MATTERS AND OTHER ATHLETICS REQUIREMENTS, AND IS LISTED AT 20 HOURS PER WEEK FOR THE FOUNDATION.
THE ORGANIZATION MADE NO CHANGES TO ITS OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART XI, LINE 2D AND PART XII, LINE 2D:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECT EXPENSES FOR FUNDRAISING EVENTS, SUCH AS CATERING, TICKETS, EQUIPMENT RENTAL, AND OTHER AMENITIES PROVIDED.
